title: Strengthening E-Learning Practical Competencies: Graduate Mathematics Education Integrating Universal Instructional Design and Ignatian Pedagogy

context.prior_knowledge: Basic understanding of foundational mathematical concepts and pedagogical frameworks
context.additional_context: Instructional design competency enhancement program for professionals in education/teaching/learning fields

learning_goals: Learners can apply the five stages of Ignatian pedagogy (context-experience-reflection-action-evaluation) to mathematics instruction.

Learners apply at least two specific strategies for each of the four core elements of Universal Design for Learning (UID) – representation, action & expression, engagement, and content – to develop one instructional material accommodating diverse learning types, including students with visual, auditory, or cognitive disabilities, achieving suitability in at least 16 out of 20 (80%) evaluation criteria from expert review
Learners can design interactive mathematics activities and build an evaluation system using digital tools (BYOD).
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
